channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: No street light in Vernon Place, in front of RA Bennet office, 11th November
item.description:
The street lights on Vernon Place have not been functioning for quite some time now. We moved here in September, and since then, we’ve noticed that the lane remains completely dark at night. Earlier, it wasn’t much of an issue because it stayed light until later in the evening, but now it gets dark around 4–5 p.m., making the whole lane 'pitch black'. It feels quite uncomfortable and even a bit fearful to walk through at night. The darkness also encourages unpleasant behaviour, especially over weekends, when people coming out of the nearby Wetherspoon often gather here to smoke, drink, shout, and sometimes urinate on the walls. It’s hardly visible because of how dark it is, but for residents, it feels very unpleasant. Proper lighting would really help improve the safety, comfort, and cleanliness of the area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Vernon Place, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Birdlip House leaking water on to the road, 11th November
item.description:
Dear Gloucestershire Highways, This is the same issue that we had last winter which led to large icy patches on the road close to the school. A significant amount of water is running out of the driveway of Birdlip house then down the Cirencester Road, making it very wet. Last winter when it was below freezing point this same issue caused large areas of the road to become covered in ice. The most significant icy area is in the national speed limit area next to the "chicane" on the exit from the main part of Birdlip village towards Parson's Pitch. When the temperature goes below freezing this will be very dangerous again this year, we need to get the leak at Birdlip House fixed for good. I appreciate this might not be your jurisdiction but you do have significant influence to bear and can if necessary involve other authorities.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Birdlip, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The drain is blocked problem, 11th November
item.description:
Blocked Drain Cheltenham GL50 1UF blocked for over a month . It has been a problem every year and Highways have cleared it in the past . It is a dangerous situation as it creates a bottleneck and a high risk of collision
